page.title: 02COGENHOE ... the past.
page.content: The geology of the area has been particularly important in the development of{Cogenhoe village. Neolithic farmers found the light soils ideal for their primitive ploughs; valley gravels provided a plentiful supply of flint too! Settlement fluctuated during the Bronze, Iron and Roman Ages. {The Oxford Dictionary of Place Names argues that COGENHOE gets its name from an Anglo-Saxon man named{CUCGA who lived on a{HOE}or hill. Others would argue that the first part is derived from{GUCKEN}(to spy); "the only place so named in England", HARTSHORNE, 1903. As time went on the pattern of life changed. A{cross}was erected in the middle of the village and as the village became more and more prosperous{churches}were built.
